attributes.action: Save Ysgol Uwchradd Caergybi’s Sixth Form
attributes.additional_details:
Please look at the information for yourself:

http://www.anglesey.gov.uk/council-and-democracy/consultations/public-engagement-review-of-the-post-16-provision/135511.article

Without a sixth form in Holyhead, parents would be looking at paying upwards of £100 travel costs.

Holyhead is a town with a population of over 13,000.
attributes.background: Anglesey Council are currently looking at changing how sixth form education is provided on the island. Their options threaten Ysgol Uwchradd Caergybi’s sixth form - leaving Holyhead with NO sixth form education, but instead forcing students to travel to either another school or even a new college.

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Welsh Government is responsible for. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it. 

The Welsh Assembly has its own Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Welsh Assembly, you can find out more here:
http://www.assembly.wales/en/gethome/e-petitions/Pages/e-petitions.aspx
